intro: Dombeya andilamenensis, commonly known as the Andean dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool and moist conditions. The leaves are usually simple and oval-shaped, with a hairy texture that helps retain moisture in its harsh environment.
